chapter.title: Circulation
chapter.para: The circulation system of a library is about the management of the library's holdings in terms of copies of documents and making them available to the readers. We often refer to the latter as the charging system.
The side menu of the circulation tab shows 5 headings : Circulation, Display items, Holds, Overdue notices and Suggestions.
Circulation is for managing readers and loans.
Display retrieves information about the library collection.
Holds enables you to manage holds placed on works available in the library by readers.

Overdue notices corresponds to overdue notices to be sent readers for unreturned items and to the recoveries to be effected. This sub-menu is available only if the Financial Management module is enabled. For more details consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Financial management.
Suggestions offers staff and readers alike the possibility to make suggestions for acquisition.

sect2.title: Loans
sect2.para: Lending out items to borrowers is very simple : you only have to enter the barcode of the reader from his membership card followed by the item barcode or accession number. Of course the same transaction can be carried out fully using a barcode reader which very conveniently replaces the manual entry of the barcode and "enter" on the keyboard.
Obviously there must already be some items and borrowers present in the database to allow for issues to be effected.

sect3.title: Borrower Search
sect3.para: A borrower search works like this: whenever you click on the Circulation tab the following screen appears. Enter the full name of the borrower or part of it in the text box and press Enter. Of course you can also read his barcode ID on his borrower's card with your scanner to display his file.
To display the complete list of borrowers leave the text box empty and press Enter. From there you can pick and choose any particular user.

sect3.title: Search results
sect3.para: Example. Let's lend out Rwanda : a people with a history, by C. M. Overdulve, to our borrower Luke Skywalker (with barcode nÂ° 100003).
His barcode is entered or read by the barcode reader to identify him.
We can also enter all or part of the borrower's name in order to select him from a list. For now we will enter the letter "s" for Skywalker.

figure.title: Circulation > Loan (results of a borrower search)

sect3.para: Click on borrower Skywalker in the search results list.

sect3.title: Borrower's card
sect3.para: The barcode of a copy of the Rwanda title is 33700003286792.
Just enter this barcode in the "new loan" field to effect the loan issue. Press Enter to validate the issue. The loan has been added to the list of current loans.

You can then cancel the loan on the fly by clicking on cancel (in this case, the loan is not taken into account for the statistics contrary to a validated loan issue immediately followed by a return).

You can also print a loan ticket. It takes the form of a PDF file generated by PMB. On Windows the "print loan ticket" button calls the Acrobat reader plugin and displays a loan ticket ready to print detailing the borrower, the item loaned and the date of return. You only have to click on the Acrobat print icon to print the loan ticket.
Starting the Acrobat reader to view the loan ticket can sometimes take rather long depending on your computer. In this case either be patient or start Acrobat well in advance.
Note. If your item has a particular status that does not allow lending, but this rule can be overridden, PMB will ask you if you want to force the loan or not.

figure.title: Item is excluded from loan: option to force the loan

sect3.para: In our example, the library parameters (name, address, logo) are those of the Bueil Library. These parameters can be customized in the administration tab. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools section.
Other available functions from the reader's fiche:

listitem.para: Effecting a fast loan

Fast loan button
Fast loan enables you to loan items that are still in cataloguing. Click on "fast loan" to enter the information necessary to issue an item that has not yet been catalogued.

Fast loan
Enter Title and ISBN. Indicate a media type (to be able to manage loan periods and quotas consequently).
Then scan your item barcode, or enter it and validate.
You may afterwards recall the record to complete the cataloguing process.
Updating borrower data (including membership renewal), see Adding a borrower, later in this document.
To update borrower data, click on the Edit button.
Extending an existing loan
To extend a loan, click on the Due button. In the calendar popup, select the new due date. In this popup, use the arrows to move forward or backward for months, and the double arrows for years.

figure.title: Date selection Popup for extending a loan

listitem.para: Extending all loans on the fly. Click on the button + to select all, then click on the date button "Extend loans of checked items until".
Deleting a borrower: possible only if the borrower has no current loans. If there are current loans, the items must be returned first.
Printing the loans records: Click on Print to print the list of borrowed items and current holds, click on Loans list to print the current loans for borrower.
Printing the borrower's card
Adding a new borrower
The add button next to Holds at the bottom allows you to place an item on hold.
After clicking on Add, carry out a search. When the item to be placed on hold is found, click on its title to insert it into the list of holds.

sect3.title: Borrower's file with Financial management enabled
sect3.para: Enabling financial management displays the borrower's library accounts (membership, loans and fines) underneath his personal data.
If you don't see these three accounts it means financial management of readers has not been enabled. For more details, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Financial management.

figure.title: reader's fiche showing the membership, loans and fines accounts

sect3.para: For more details on the financial management of readers, go to the next section on Loans and financial management.

sect2.title: Loans and financial management
sect2.para: For more details on enabling the financial management of readers in PMB, consult the chapter Financial management of the Administrator's Guide.

sect3.title: Adding a new reader and debiting the reader's account with the subscription dues
sect3.para: When you add a new adult reader, for instance, Jar-Jar Bings, and you have already set the subscription dues for "adult readers", then his account will automatically be debited with the corresponding amount.
In short, for more details on adding new readers, consult the section New readerin this chapter.

Pour saisir le paiement de l'adhésion, cliquez sur Solde abonnement. The membership account of the new reader is debited with the subscription dues. To enter the amount payable, click on subscription balance.

sect3.title: Subscription balance : enter the subscription amount
sect3.para: If the reader's account is negative, several operations are possible :

listitem.para: Fast Cash in : makes it possible to settle a reader's account quickly. With Fast cash in, all transactions are automatically validated. Click on Fast Cash in and enter the amount paid by the reader.
Cash in : makes it possible to enter a payment, but the transaction is not automatically validated.
Validate the checked transactions : it validates a transaction!
Delete checked transactions
Special transactions
Special transactions make it possible to :
credit the account ("gift" to the reader) eventually to record the amount in bad debts. In this case, the amount is written off from the library's account.
debit the account ("penalty" for the reader).
credit the account and cash in: enter a reader's payment

debit the account and write off : enter a fine for the reader and eventually record it in bad debts. In this case, the amount is written off from the library's account. In particular this makes it possible to record a fine for damaging an item.

sect3.para: In our example, to record the payment of the 5 Euros subscription dues of Jar-Jar Bings, click on Fast Cash in and enter the amount.
Note : you can always go back to the reader's fiche by clicking on the link Go back to the reader's fiche.

sect3.title: Lend out an item and debit the reader's account with the respective amount
sect3.para: If the amount due for a DVD loan is $3, the reader's account will be debited accordingly when the loan is validated.
Note. For more details about loans, consult the section Loans in this chapter.

sect3.title: Loan settlement : enter the amount payable for the loan
sect3.para: Loans dues are always recorded but not validated automatically. To validate the transaction, click on Loans cleared. You can either validate the transaction or delete it by checking the selection box and choosing the appropriate action.
For more information about the various possibilities (cash-in, write-off, ...) consult the above section Subscription balance.

sect3.title: Overdue loans : loan suspension and fines
sect3.para: In the case of late returns, subject to the loans parameters defined in the Administration tab, the reader can be fined and/or subjected to a loans suspension.
All settlements are made from the reader's fiche like for all transactions.

sect3.title: Fines clearance : fines management
sect3.para: For more information about the various possibilities (cash-in, write-off, ...) consult above the section Subscription balance.

sect2.title: Return items
sect2.para: Scan the item barcode only, the reader's card is not necessary.
A confirmation message is displayed enabling you to check whether the barcode corresponds to the document returned.
This area shows the name of the reader returning the volume. It is a link to the reader's fiche, for example, to record new loans.
Are also displayed :

listitem.para: the media type, the location, the section and the classmark of the item
If the item is overdue, the number of days
The previous borrower's name
the copy message, if any
any outstanding holds

sect2.para: The reader's fiche is also displayed and allows on the fly operations : you can extend a loan or place an item on hold for example. For more information, consult the section "reader's fiche" above.
Fines and suspensions can be inflicted on readers. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, financial management.

sect2.title: Borrowers Groups
sect2.para: The Borrowers groups feature enables PMB librarians to organize their readership in groups : classes, families, etc.

sect3.title: Barcode for the new borrower
sect3.para: A borrower barcode is required whenever you want to add a new borrower. If the pmb.num_carte_auto parameter is active (value = 1), PMB will suggest a new borrower barcode equivalent to the highest barcode +1 in the database.
For more details on PMB parameters, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools.
Once a borrower card number has been defined, click on the Next button to display the New borrower data entry screen.
Note: Validation (Click on the next button) is automatic with a barcode reader.

sect3.title: Enter the borrower's data
sect3.para: You can enter the borrower's personal data on this screen.

If new fields were defined in Administration > Borrowers > Customizable fields, they will be visible at the bottom of the borrower's fiche. On the above screen, you will notice the new field "Corporate Name". To enter a different barcode, replace the entry with a barcode of your choice or scan the new barcode.
If you enter a barcode that is already allocated, PMB will display an error message.
Note :

listitem.para: A last name must always be entered
A first name must always be entered

The date of birth is among the statistical data required by regional library services for libraries within their networks. It is mandatory unless the parameter empr.birthdate_optional has been set to 1. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools, Parameters.

The fields OPAC Login ID and OPAC password define the login ID of the borrower in the OPAC (usually situated in the left column). If these fields are not filled in when adding a new reader they will have the following values by default :
for the Login ID : First letter of first name + last name.
for the password: year of birth (yyyy) if it is entered, otherwise 0.

new fields, if any, are displayed at the bottom of the borrower's fiche. They enable you to add all types of data to a borrower's fiche. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Borrowers.

sect2.title: by barcode
sect2.para: Enter a barcode to display the corresponding item entry.

figure.title: Circulation > Display items > by barcode; first screen
Circulation > Display items > by barcode ; results screen

sect2.title: by author/title
sect2.para: Here you get a screen which works like the search section in catalogue. (See Catalogue later on). You can enter a title or an author as the starting point of your search.
You can use truncations here with regular expressions. To find more about this subject, click on the link "regular expressions".
You can also search by ISBN, commercial number (EAN), or as above, by accessions number (barcode).

sect1.title: Holds
sect1.para: PMB allows you to place holds on items for borrowers. Holds are accessible in the Circulation tab in a borrower's fiche (loan items) and, depending on the settings, from borrower's fiche in the OPAC. (For more information about configuring the OPAC, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.)
From version 1.3 onwards, PMB has an Advanced hold management feature.

sect2.title: Outstanding
sect2.para: This screen displays current holds. A waiting list in order of ranking is displayed if many borrowers have placed the same item on hold.

Holds are displayed as unconfirmed. As soon as a hold is added, the officer in charge of holds retrieves the corresponding items from the shelves, and puts them aside. To edit the list of items to retrieve from the shelves, click on the tabManagement, menu Process items on hold. (For more information, see ).
Next the barcodes of the items put aside are scanned. The holds are then "validated".
If you wish to delete a hold, Click the Delete option, then click on the button Validate deletions.
You can print the relevant hold confirmation letters. To do this, click on the button Confirmation Letters

sect2.title: Expired
sect2.para: The screen of expired holds lists the holds that were not cancelled and for which the valid date is past. You must therefore delete them. To delete a hold, select the Delete option then click on the button Validate deletions.
You can, if you wish, give additional time to holds already expired. In this case, do not delete the expired holds until after the new extension period.

sect2.title: Items to shelve
sect2.para: The list of items to shelve contains documents placed on hold that were normally removed from the shelves and held under borrowers' names, and the holds were subsequently deleted. Held items are usually kept at the library issue counter; "items to shelve" allows you to take stock of items that must be reshelved.

sect1.title: Overdue notices
sect1.para: Overdue notices advanced management is related to financial management. For more information about enabling the financial management feature, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Financial management.

sect2.title: to do
sect2.para: On this screen, you can consult the list of readers whom to send overdue notices to for late returns.
You can print overdue notices for every reader. These reminders vary in content depending on the overdue level. Level 2 is the lowest (slightly late).
When the overdue notice has been sent out, you can change your reader's overdue level.
For every reader, you can :

listitem.para: see his/her barcode, name, number of late items
see the last validated overdue level (corresponds to the overdue notice of the highest level, i.e., the smallest number)
see the date of the last validation (corresponds to the last overdue notice sent out)
see the actual overdue level : it is the overdue level rendered by PMB in relation to the degree of lateness on documents on loan
change the overdue level, and if necessary, go to recoveries

sect2.title: Recoveries
sect2.para: Going to recoveries means transmitting a reader's accounts to a body/institution responsible for recoveries, for instance, collecting any unpaid fines.
This screen is mainly for reference. Indeed, when a reader's account is transferred to Recoveries, they are not anymore the responsibility of the library or documentation centre.

sect1.title: Suggestions
sect1.para: This feature enables you to make suggestions regarding works for acquisitions to the library or resource centre authorities.

sect2.title: Make a suggestion
sect2.para: For more information on adding a new suggestion, refer to the chapter Acquistions : in this guide.
